$interpreted: Dagger: Alright? You haven't spoken a single word.
Angelia: I'm thinking of ways to not overexploit the Bears' gem rocks...something Chieftain Crushfang will agree to,
Angelia: and also persuade King Theodore.
Dagger: Taking this quite seriously, aren't you...
Dagger: Also, this Theodore you keep mentioning, who he is?
Angelia: My uncle. My mother, the Queen, passed away during my birth. My father passed when I was five years old.
Angelia: Ever since then, my uncle raised me, and tended to national politics on my behalf.
Dagger: So he's the one who allowed the humans to harass the Bears and turned a blind eye to illegal miners. It's obvious that he's rotten to the core!
Angelia: You've misunderstood. My uncle treats me very well. He can be a bit strict, but far from wicked.
Dagger: Oh really?
Golemwalt: Grrrouuu~
Angelia: Haha, this Golem is huge!
Dagger: Golemwalt?
Golemwalt: Grrrooouuu~
Angelia: Golemwalt? Has he a name?
Dagger: Just him. Stories tell of a young Golemwalt wandering the wilderness for decades, becoming accustomed to the company of humans.
Dagger: He approves of you, which means that you're not bad at heart.
Angelia: I'm not a bad person...are those the gem rocks on his back?
Dagger: The bodies of deceased Golems will become one with soil and stone, leaving gem rocks behind as their legacy.
Dagger: In other words, gem rocks are living proofs that Golems once roamed here.
Angelia: (So the gemstone necklace uncle gave me, it came from something with such a heavy price...)
Dagger: Hurry. Otherwise, you'll have to spend the night here.
Angelia: Mhm. Golemwalt, see you again one day.
Golemwalt: Grrrouuu~
Angelia: And you are...?
Soldier: Your Highness, Madam Aldric ordered me to wait, mentioning to escort Your Highness on the way out.
Angelia: So, Sione sent you.
Angelia: Sir Dagger, we shall meet again.
Soldier: Princess, please follow me this way.
Dagger: You sure are one ditzy princess... still can't tell friend from foe.
Angelia: Sir Dagger?
Dagger: The routes in these caves are tangled and twisted. Without a Bear warrior's guidance, how did you manage to get this far?
Soldier?: This, err, I don't know...
Dagger: Who the hell are you?!
Dagger: Angelia!
Dagger: Golemwalt! Perfect timing!
Golemwalt: Grrrouuu~
Dagger: Damn it, how did these assassins get inside! What are the people outside up to?!
Angelia: Sir Dagger!
Dagger: What's that matter? What's happened out here?
Sione: ...We were ambushed with rune devices...Princess... where's the princess?
Dagger: Damn it, we've been tricked!

Model.Text: Alright? You haven't spoken a single word.
I'm thinking of ways to not overexploit the Bears' gem rocks...something Chieftain Crushfang will agree to,
and also persuade King Theodore.
Taking this quite seriously, aren't you...
Also, this Theodore you keep mentioning, who he is?
My uncle. My mother, the Queen, passed away during my birth. My father passed when I was five years old.
Ever since then, my uncle raised me, and tended to national politics on my behalf.
So he's the one who allowed the humans to harass the Bears and turned a blind eye to illegal miners. It's obvious that he's rotten to the core!
You've misunderstood. My uncle treats me very well. He can be a bit strict, but far from wicked.
